Great playlist - I'm following it now. Are you taking submissions? I'm a composer and released this piano version of the main theme: Game of Thrones Theme (Piano Version )[https://spoti.fi/2VItkRs](https://spoti.fi/2VItkRs)
:) - for some reasons, there seems to be a link between music that sounds sad to me, and music that sounds beautiful. So, I'm actually rarely sad when I listen to sad music.
Thanks! I've been listening to it while working and it's nice to have this type of music in the background to help zone in on work.
No, thank you! #128578;

Incredible suggestions! I'm going to add this track to it. Thank you!!! [https://open.spotify.com/track/2l0U7SkWRw2EuvnVAhvLv5?si=RGaozqRtQK6G5ERXFDVnVg](https://open.spotify.com/track/2l0U7SkWRw2EuvnVAhvLv5?si=RGaozqRtQK6G5ERXFDVnVg)

Great question. I just found this really interesting article with an infographic that provides a scientific explanation: [https://www.siliconrepublic.com/advice/how-does-music-impact-your-productivity-at-work](https://www.siliconrepublic.com/advice/how-does-music-impact-your-productivity-at-work) All this being said, I'm sure total silence is better for some people too! :)
Another study showing this link too: [https://qz.com/work/1573440/why-music-affects-your-productivity/](https://qz.com/work/1573440/why-music-affects-your-productivity/)

gt;https://qz.com/work/1573440/why-music-affects-your-productivity/ Glad you found it useful :) - Just posted another article below, but thought I'd share here too: [https://qz.com/work/1573440/why-music-affects-your-productivity/](https://qz.com/work/1573440/why-music-affects-your-productivity/)

So kind of you to say - I'm working on making it as best as possible to help people out. I know how helpful it is to have something in the background to help me focus. If there's a track you don't like or find "distracting", feel free let me know (if you have time of course), because this is what helps when creating these playlists! :) Thank you.

Here are a few articles backing this up: [https://qz.com/work/1573440/why-music-affects-your-productivity/](https://qz.com/work/1573440/why-music-affects-your-productivity/) And: [https://www.siliconrepublic.com/advice/how-does-music-impact-your-productivity-at-work](https://www.siliconrepublic.com/advice/how-does-music-impact-your-productivity-at-work)
So instead of "SAD CELLO" - "INTENSE CELLO" :) - that could be fun to create!
Thanks for the recommendation! I added it. It is absolutely exquisite.

This is very hard for me. When I'm working on something that doesn't require the internet, I disable WIFI. Here are some thoughts: 1. Love the pomodoro idea - if you only have 25 mins and you have a set goal in mind, and you set that as a psychological limit, then you might be more likely to stay focused to complete the task. 2. Allow yourself 5 minutes in between pomodoros and force yourself to do something on the Internet that is fun. It's your reward. 3. Maybe a mantra or something to remind you about the importance of time as an entrepreneur ... "time is money" Hope this helps???

When you're social, be grateful, mindful of the experience and fully let yourself enjoy it. Remember that breaks allow you to recharge. When you're working, remember that you'll always be missing out on something, but you'll get to really enjoy it (fun things) when your work is done. Does this help?

[https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/306c/1bf669b0232e662a1195b4c4d52b016759de.pdf](https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/306c/1bf669b0232e662a1195b4c4d52b016759de.pdf) Here's REALLY scientific article with data to prove this point! For science nerds like me, check out section 6.2.4
Relevant results are in section 6.2.4.
Any suggestions would be **very** much appreciated! Always on the look out for new music.
I'll have a listen and see if it's a fit. Thanks!

Hello! I practice yoga at home and music is very important to my practice. I think the easiest way to have music that is sequenced appropriately is to search for playlists that already pre-made by other yogis or yoga teachers. I use Spotify and created this playlist that I (and now a few others) use for a 60 minute practice session. Hope this helps? [https://open.spotify.com/user/ikwong1979/playlist/78weibiq4jkrAYI5ux4bwh?si=07VTvZt4TuW1tvBJmDN6AA](https://open.spotify.com/user/ikwong1979/playlist/78weibiq4jkrAYI5ux4bwh?si=07VTvZt4TuW1tvBJmDN6AA)

I think I would be interested in your playlists! Would you be willing to share a link to them or are they private? (that's okay if they are!). Here's what I did for a 60 minute class: [https://open.spotify.com/user/ikwong1979/playlist/78weibiq4jkrAYI5ux4bwh?si=07VTvZt4TuW1tvBJmDN6AA](https://open.spotify.com/user/ikwong1979/playlist/78weibiq4jkrAYI5ux4bwh?si=07VTvZt4TuW1tvBJmDN6AA)

Re: music - I'm a musician and teach piano. I think there are great online tools, but to learn effectively, it's important to have someone next to you providing you with immediate feedback. If $$ is a concern, you could consider doing a lot of online stuff on your own, and then taking fewer lessons - I'd still suggest lessons to make sure you're not developing bad habits etc. - Good luck! And good choice considering music - you won't regret it.
Thank you! I'm glad you like it #128578;. Let me know if you come across any songs that get in the way of your flow.
Feedback most welcome and appreciated.
Neat! That's a really artistic photo.
I'm glad you found it useful.

One where people study. I live in University town. Increasingly, coffee shops are full of people doing work. [https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0961000617742469](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0961000617742469)

From the article "Although library caf #233;s are perceived mostly for social networking and recreational purposes, an increasing number of students are conducting both their formal and informal learning at the library caf #233;s, instead of inside the physical libraries." But I take your point - definitely not for the vast majority of coffee shops.

Sure thing! Here's an article: https://qz.com/work/1573440/why-music-affects-your-productivity/ From the article ... "For example, if you #8217;re about to read a lengthy and comprehensive document, you #8217;re probably better off listening to ambient or classical music, than rock or pop music. And vice versa, if you #8217;re about to go for a run."

Yes, I suppose that it could be interpreted that way. This article suggests the link more clearly. I wish there were citations in this article, but I'm going to take it at face value that studies exist . [https://avdg.com/studies-show-ambient-music-office-increases-productivity/](https://avdg.com/studies-show-ambient-music-office-increases-productivity/)

WRITING.TITLE: I made a Settler's of Catan Spotify playlist with 2 hours of epic Cinematic Tracks to enhance the match - full disclosure - several tracks are mine
